channel.title: Sever problems
channel.description:
Where in my server source is the file that I see what ip its trying to connect to.. I don't see one in source, only in my client which the file in client is client.java... Whats the file called in my server source?
Also What ip do I put it under so just me can connect.. I tried 0.0.0.0 and I can't connect, I just checked and my 43594 port is open, but nothing will work.. I even tried my own ip and 43594 port in those 2 port spots and those 2 ip spots.. What do I do.. Is this right to connect for my self? Because its not working.. And what do I put in as port I just want to play it privately while i am working on it [URL=http://swiftkit.net][IMG]http://img593.imageshack.us/img593/2071/mrfp.png[/img][/URL]
Thanks

item.title: Sever problems
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Yes, you got that error because there is 2 lines that are the exact same, that’s what I was pointing out. Probably why one was commented.
You can also try setting it to: 127.0.0.1
That’s localhost too, but just in a different format

Read full topic

item.title: Sever problems
item.dc:creator: @Angel_Carlos Angel Carlos
item.description:
@Angel_Carlos wrote:

It means, theirs a nother line that is the same, already defined, just remove that whole line.

Read full topic

item.title: Sever problems
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:524405”][quote author=yuk link=topic=642948.msg4329756#msg4329756 date=1373481073]

localhost would make it so only you can connect, and you don’t need port 43594 open for localhost.
Also, the line that is highlighted is commented out.

So do I leave the port spot blank, and how do I fix it if it is commented out?

No, leave the port on 43594, I’m just saying you don’t have to open it.

also, 2 lines down from the highlighted one, is the one you want to edit.
Just remove that “”+defaultServer+""; crap and put:
“localhost”;

It still says error, and all those 3 lines have localhost?
[/quote]
Do you compile each time?[/quote] I was getting this error, but I fixed it I took out the //, But I added them back. Yes I compiled each time I change it.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Do you compile each time?
